meanings.sent1: She was unknitting the scarf to fix a mistake.
meanings.sent2: I had to unknit the sweater because it was too small.
meanings.sent3: The cat thought unknitting the yarn ball was a fun game.
meanings.sent4: Her decision to unknit their friendship left him feeling lost.
meanings.sent5: The unknitting process revealed the intricate pattern hidden within.

meanings.definition: To unravel or take apart something that has been knitted.
meanings.sent1: He carefully unknitted the tangled mess of yarn.
meanings.sent2: The old blanket was unknitted to make new scarves.
meanings.sent3: The unknitting of the sweater revealed a hidden message.
meanings.sent4: She felt like unknitting her life and starting fresh.
meanings.sent5: The unknitting process required patience and precision.

meanings.definition: To disentangle or separate something that has been knitted.
meanings.sent1: She was unknitting the knots in the yarn.
meanings.sent2: The unknitting of the snarled threads took hours.
meanings.sent3: He tried unknitting the mess but only made it worse.
meanings.sent4: The unknitting of the friendship was necessary for both.
meanings.sent5: The unknitting process required a gentle touch to avoid damage.
